result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:22AM Defendant Ryan Anthony Bowman in court in custody from the Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Ryan Anthony Bowman. Cases called: 19 CF 340 and 22 CF 274, Court addresses motion for furlough filed by defendant, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 in 19 CF 340, Court finds defendant guilty in Ct. 1, withholds adjudication, approves the DPA in Ct. 1 for 24 months, Court finds defendant guilty in Ct. 2 and Ct. 3, Judgment to be entered, 22 CF 274 dismissed, read in, Ct. 2, Court withholds sentence, probation 24 months, $443.00 costs, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Ct. 3, Court withholds sentence, probation 24 months, $243.00 costs, defendant to submit DNA Sample, stipulation to be filed on sentence credit, 11:50 A.M.
